alert.note: Alert for Bradley; McMinn; Northwest Monroe; West Polk (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 27 at 7:43PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN BRADLEY...NORTHWESTERN POLK AND SOUTHEASTERN MCMINN COUNTIES THROUGH 930 PM EST... At 842 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wildwood Lake, or 11 miles south of Cleveland, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Cleveland, Athens, Benton, Etowah, South Cleveland, East Cleveland, Wildwood Lake, Englewood, Waterville, and Conasauga. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bradley; McMinn; Northwest Monroe; West Polk
